div.bibl: Illinois Staats Zeitung, Jan. 6, 1900. GERMAN SOCIETY

body.p: The Board of Directors of the German Society held its regular monthly meeting yesterday afternoon at which Mr. Wilhelm Vocke, the president of the society, presided. The following report was given by the society's business manager which covers the society's activities for the month of December 1899: Of the 190 cases applying for help, 179 have received consideration. Furthermore, help has been extended to 129 families and 48 single persons, and 203 persons received employment. During the past three months the German Society extended help to 263 families, including 803 children and 138 single persons. The society purchased and distributed 33 pairs of shoes, 79 half tons of coal, and in 56 instances paid for food and rent, with a total expenditure of $1,362.40 against the income of paid membership dues to $711.00.
